parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Trans: I bring near; intrans: I come near, approach. From eggus; to make near, i.e. approach.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Trans: I bring near; intrans: I come near, approach. From eggus; to make near, i.e. approach.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To cleanse, make clean, literally, ceremonially, or spiritually, according to context. From katharos; to cleanse.
Sinning, sinful, depraved, detestable. From hamartano; sinful, i.e. A sinner.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To cleanse, purify, either ceremonially, actually, or morally. From hagnos; to make clean, i.e. sanctify.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
(lit: of two souls, of two selves), double-minded, wavering. From dis and psuche; two-spirited, i.e. Vacillating.
